meanings.definition: To make a mess or disorder of; to disarrange; to make untidy; to rumple; to tousle.
meanings.sent1: I was messin up my room by leaving toys everywhere.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys messin up her hair to create a unique style.
meanings.sent3: The cat was messin up the neatly folded laundry.
meanings.sent4: The wind was messin up the leaves, swirling them around.
meanings.sent5: The kids were messin up the sandcastle they built at the beach.

meanings.definition: To interfere; to meddle; to put one's self forward; to intrude.
meanings.sent1: Stop messin in other people's business.
meanings.sent2: He was always messin with the TV settings.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was messin with the bird feeder, trying to steal seeds.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise was messin with my concentration.
meanings.sent5: The siblings were messin with each other, playing pranks.

meanings.definition: To take the part of a friend in a quarrel; to support; to befriend.
meanings.sent1: I will always be there for you, messin with you in tough times.
meanings.sent2: She was messin with her best friend during the argument.
meanings.sent3: The dog was messin with the cat, standing by its side.
meanings.sent4: The sun was messin with the clouds, shining through.
meanings.sent5: The team was messin with each other, cheering on their teammate.
